question: 職員
sourceMnemonic:
The <kanji>employment</kanji> <kanji>member</kanji>s of a workplace are the <vocabulary>personnel</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>staff</vocabulary>. Pretty straightforward!

<ja>職員</ja> and <ja>社員</ja> are two similar terms, but have different meanings. <ja>社員</ja> generally refers to employees of private companies, while <ja>職員</ja> refers to employees who work in various fields such as civil service, education, government, non-profits, and more.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
